page.title: 19ASHTON MILL 1
page.content: Ashton Mill is located on the main road from Oundle to Polebrook. It lies outside the village of Ashton on the River Nene. It is on lower land than the rest of the village. In the original Domesday Book there is the following entry :- { "In Ashton 4 1/2 hides. Land for { 8 ploughs. In lordship 2 ploughs, { with 1 slave; 11 villagers and 2 { smallholders with 6 ploughs. { 2 mills at 4Os and 325 eels; { meadow, 16 acres; woodland, 4 { acres. The value was 1s; now Â£7." We do not think that there is any physical evidence of the original mills but we think it is likely that they were near the present site which is 'just down the hill from the church'.
